<p>This page describes the sequence fragments used by the Consult and
Obtain Laboratory Results, Imaging Reports and Hospital Discharge
Reports, referring the possible implementation options.</p>
<h3 id="business-view">Business View</h3>
<p>The Patient Search fragment is documented in the <a
href="sequence-pat.html">Patient Search page</a></p>
<p>Hereafter is shown the 'Search and Get' or 'Fetch' Report(s)
fragment.</p>
<table align="center"><tr><td>
<img
src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," />
</td></tr></table>
<h3 id="application-view">Application View</h3>

<p>In this first version, this will be realized by <strong>searching per
DocumentReference</strong></p>
<p>This option infact allows to search for any kind of document
indipendently by its format. For example it could include and/or refer
the PDF and the corresponding FHIR (or CDA) representation.</p>
<p>A DocumentReference resource can refer/include more representations
of the same document.</p>
<table align="center"><tr><td><img
src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," />
</tr></td></table>
<h4 id="request-search--fetch-reports">Request: Search / Fetch
Report(s)</h4>
<table>
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Consumer</th>
<th>Provider</th>
<th>searchParameter</th>
<th>type</th>
<th>notes</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Document type</td>
<td>SHALL</td>
<td>SHALL</td>
<td><a
href="https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/documentreference.html#search">type</a></td>
<td><a href="https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/search.html#token">token</a></td>
<td> </td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Type of content</td>
<td>MAY</td>
<td>SHALL</td>
<td><a
href="https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/documentreference.html#search">contenttype</a></td>
<td><a href="https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/search.html#token">token</a></td>
<td> </td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Study type</td>
<td>MAY</td>
<td>SHALL</td>
<td><a
href="https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/documentreference.html#search">category</a></td>
<td><a href="https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/search.html#token">token</a></td>
<td> </td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Patient business identifier</td>
<td>SHALL</td>
<td>SHALL</td>
<td><a
href="https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/documentreference.html#search">patient</a></td>
<td><a
href="https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/search.html#reference">reference</a></td>
<td>It requires chained parameter (patient.identifier) supported</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Date</td>
<td>SHALL</td>
<td>SHALL</td>
<td><a
href="https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/documentreference.html#search">date</a></td>
<td><a href="https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/search.html#date">date</a></td>
<td> </td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Creation Date</td>
<td>MAY</td>
<td>MAY</td>
<td><a
href="https://profiles.ihe.net/ITI/MHD/SearchParameter-DocumentReference-Creation.html">creation</a></td>
<td><a href="https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/search.html#date">date</a></td>
<td>It specifies a search against the
DocumentReference.content.attachment.creation</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p><strong>The provider shall support the combination of required search
parameters</strong></p>
<p>Please note that the <em>date</em> parameter refers to the date when
the DocumentReference has been created. A query against the effective
document creation date may be optionally perfomed by using the
SearchParameter <a
href="https://profiles.ihe.net/ITI/MHD/SearchParameter-DocumentReference-Creation.html">creation</a>.</p>
<h5 id="examples">Examples</h5>
<p>All the lab reports of the Czech patient 456789123 created from 2023,
Feb 20th.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><code
class="language-plaintext highlighter-rouge">GET $server/DocumentReference?type=http://loinc.org|11502-2&amp;patient.identifier=https://ncez.mzcr.cz/standards/fhir/sid/rid|456789123&amp;date=ge2023-02-20</code></p>
</blockquote>
<p>All the lab reports of the Czech patient 456789123 of type PDF.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><code
class="language-plaintext highlighter-rouge">GET $server/DocumentReference?type=http://loinc.org|11502-2&amp;patient.identifier=https://ncez.mzcr.cz/standards/fhir/sid/rid|456789123&amp;contenttype=application/pdf</code></p>
</blockquote>
<p>All the Microbiology lab reports of the Czech patient 456789123 of
the 6 months (assuming that today is 2024-03-25)</p>
<blockquote>
<p><code
class="language-plaintext highlighter-rouge">GET $server/DocumentReference?type=http://loinc.org|11502-2&amp;patient.identifier=https://ncez.mzcr.cz/standards/fhir/sid/rid|456789123&amp;category=http://loinc.org|18725-2&amp;date=ge2023-09-25</code></p>
</blockquote>
<h4 id="response-search--fetch-reports">Response: Search / Fetch
Report(s)</h4>
<p>If present, a search set Bundle including a set of DocumentReference
compliant with the <a
href="StructureDefinition-DocumentReference-minimal-myhealtheu.html">DocumentReferenceMyHealthEu</a>
profile is returned.</p>
<p>Each DocumentReference may return or refer one or more
representations (e.g. PDF, HL7 CDA, HL7 FHIR json) of a specific
document instance.</p>
<p>If the document is included in the content.data element we are in the
FETCH case.</p>
<p>If the document is referred in the content.url element we are in the
SEARCH AND GET case.</p>
<p>In this case it is expected that the <a
href="https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/datatypes-definitions.html#Attachment.url"><em>url</em></a>
element contains the actual url to be used for retrieving this docuemnt
from the HL7 FHIR API.</p>
<h4 id="request-getting-reports-by-id">Request: Getting Report(s) by
ID</h4>
<p>In the SEARCH AND GET case for each selected document it is possible
to retrieve the document(s) by getting them using the provided url.</p>
<p>Two options are considered:</p>
<ol>
<li>the content type is HL7 FHIR (it might be json, xml or RDF)</li>
<li>the content type is not HL7 FHIR (e.d. PDF, HL7 CDA)</li>
</ol>
<h5 id="hl7-fhir-documents">HL7 FHIR documents</h5>
<p>In the first case (HL7 FHIR documents) the resource to be retrieved
is of type <a href="https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html">Bundle</a> and
the Request will be of type:</p>
<blockquote>
<p><code
class="language-plaintext highlighter-rouge">GET $server/Bundle/id</code></p>
</blockquote>
<h5 id="non-hl7-fhir-documents">NON HL7 FHIR documents</h5>
<p>In the second case (non HL7 FHIR documents) the resource to be
retrieved is of type <a
href="https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/binary.html">Binary</a> and the Request
will be of type:</p>
<blockquote>
<p><code
class="language-plaintext highlighter-rouge">GET $server/Binary/id</code></p>
</blockquote>
<h4 id="response-getting-reports-by-id">Response: Getting Report(s) by
ID</h4>
<h5 id="hl7-fhir-documents-1">HL7 FHIR documents</h5>
<p>A Document Bundle conformant with the profile defined for that kind
of document is returned.</p>
<h5 id="non-hl7-fhir-documents-1">NON HL7 FHIR documents</h5>
<p>A Document Binary including the document in PDF or HL7 CDA is
returned.</p>
<h4 id="http-error-response-codes">HTTP Error Response Codes</h4>
<table>
<thead>
<tr>
<th>HTTP Response</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>401 Unauthorized</td>
<td>authorization is required for the interaction that was
attempted</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>404 Not Found</td>
<td>resource type not supported, or not a FHIR end-point</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>410 Gone</td>
<td>resource deleted or no more active</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
